Author: jl777c#5810
Content: first CPU mine with max cores you have available until it gets to a stable diff. RST should start at 65, then go for 30 to 40 blocks, then it will stop and the second hash in the mining printout will go to 0

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: i am talking about ZAWY20, the plan for testing so you can do it on your own

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: you see in the .csv, there are two hashes, the one on the right means RST is active and things go in slow motion. after the deficits are caught up (or 40 blocks), it will stop and the second hash will go to 0. at that point it is just the normal digishield on its own. after 17 blocks of 0s, we hope nothing triggers and the hash rate is reasonably stable. assuming it is, then reduce to 1 core mining

Author: SHossain#0007
Content:
- start the chain #20
- mine with 50 threads till height 65, after that RST will kick in
- continue mining about 40 blocks until the second hash is 0
- mine more 17 blocks with second hash 0
- then, start single thread to stabilize diff

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: its not so exact.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: first of all, nothing happens until height 65

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: with 50 threads, you will get there in less than a minute

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: then RST kicks in and things will slow down. keep things until the second hash goes to 0 AND hashrate stabilizes, making sure after it goes to 0s, that exp() or RST doesnt kick in again. it isnt a fatal thing, but nice if RST kicks in and fixes things and there arent any echoes, ie, other triggers after it goes to the 0s
